content:
I'm really excited to start with the character interview exercise. I have a character in mind, a young woman named Sophia who's the protagonist of my story. She's a bit of a rebel, always challenging authority and pushing boundaries. But I want to explore what drives her, what makes her tick, and what her deepest fears and desires are.

I think I'll start by asking her some questions about her childhood and her relationships with her family and friends. I want to know what shaped her into the person she is today and what motivates her to take risks and challenge the status quo.

Do you think it's a good idea to ask her about her goals and aspirations as well? I want to know what she wants to achieve in her life and what's holding her back from getting there.
